text.__SUMMARY__: Beddome's worm snake (Gerrhopilus beddomii) is a species of harmless blind snake in the family Gerrhopilidae. The species is endemic to southern India. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Etymology: It is named after Richard Henry Beddome (1830-1911), a British army officer and botanist.
text.Geographic range:
Beddome's worm snake is found in southern India in the Western Ghats and in the Kimedy Hills near Visakhapatnam in eastern India.
The type locality given is "Hills of the Indian Peninsula ... Kimedy Hills, (Visakhapatnam district) and in the Anaimalai and Travancore Hills between 2000 and 5000 feet" (about 600–1500 m).
